channel.title: Comments on: Heaven Help You If You Messed With Their Cheese Plate

item.title: By: DrBlur
item.dc:creator: DrBlur
item.description:
These are great memories people. I'm a huge Blur fan, wrote a book on them. If you're interested in Blur check out my website.
I'm looking for copies of tapes of three Atlanta Blur shows ('94 at Masquerade, '96 at Cotton Club, '03 at Tabernacle), if anyone has them, please contact me :-)
item.content:encoded:
These are great memories people. I’m a huge Blur fan, wrote a book on them. If you’re interested in Blur check out my website.

I’m looking for copies of tapes of three Atlanta Blur shows (’94 at Masquerade, ’96 at Cotton Club, ’03 at Tabernacle), if anyone has them, please contact me ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: AJW
item.dc:creator: AJW
item.description: Dude...that's almost like that infamous Klaus Nomi / Twisted Sister double bill.
item.content:encoded: Dude…that’s almost like that infamous Klaus Nomi / Twisted Sister double bill.

item.title: By: K
item.dc:creator: K
item.description:
Hey, now that I think about it, I was at that Tabernacle show. Moving Units opened up for them. Twas strange without Graham.
The strangest blur show I think I've ever seen was when Smash Mouth opened for them in Santa Barbara. Yeah, Smash Mouth. WTF?! The crowd was full of frat boys. Totally bizarre.
item.content:encoded:
Hey, now that I think about it, I was at that Tabernacle show. Moving Units opened up for them. Twas strange without Graham.

The strangest blur show I think I’ve ever seen was when Smash Mouth opened for them in Santa Barbara. Yeah, Smash Mouth. WTF?! The crowd was full of frat boys. Totally bizarre.

item.title: By: AJW
item.dc:creator: AJW
item.description: By the way, great article. I loved Sleeper's fromage-themed anecdote.
item.content:encoded: By the way, great article. I loved Sleeper’s fromage-themed anecdote.

item.title: By: K
item.dc:creator: K
item.description: Everything is always sold out in LDN. It's so annoying.
item.content:encoded: Everything is always sold out in LDN. It’s so annoying.

item.title: By: AJW
item.dc:creator: AJW
item.description: When I was in London in 1994, they were playing Shepherd's Bush Empire, right about the time of the release of Parklife. Sadly, that show was sold out. I was starting to think I'd never seem them live!
item.content:encoded: When I was in London in 1994, they were playing Shepherd’s Bush Empire, right about the time of the release of Parklife. Sadly, that show was sold out. I was starting to think I’d never seem them live!

item.title: By: K
item.dc:creator: K
item.description:
In reply to <a href="./../index.html#comment-1677">AJW</a>.
I was at the Cotton Club show, as well. Don't know if there were tix for that show. But the first time I saw them was at Masquerade. I think I saw blur 3 times in Atlanta, but I may be mistaken. I've seen them on both US coasts but sadly never in the UK.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to AJW.

I was at the Cotton Club show, as well. Don’t know if there were tix for that show. But the first time I saw them was at Masquerade. I think I saw blur 3 times in Atlanta, but I may be mistaken. I’ve seen them on both US coasts but sadly never in the UK.
